definition: a magnet/same as 磁鐵|磁铁
to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
iron (metal)/arms/weapons/hard/strong/violent/unshakeable/determined/close/tight (slang)
surname Tie
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Shi

sentences.english: The dampened cloth makes a great dirt magnet.
sentences.chinese: 一般來說，溼布是一塊絕妙的灰塵吸鐵石。

sentences.english: These filters are dust and pollen magnets.
sentences.chinese: 這些過濾器是灰塵和花粉的“吸鐵石”。

sentences.english: Coaster has a small magnet can attract the love spoon.
sentences.chinese: 杯墊有小吸鐵石可以吸住勺子。

sentences.english: Xitie Dan found through experiments to explore the absorption of iron.
sentences.chinese: 通過實驗探索發現吸鐵石吸鐵的特性。

sentences.english: Someday we may discover how to make magnets that can point in any direction.
sentences.chinese: 有一天我們可能會造出能指向任何方向的吸鐵石。

definition: Every family goes through its problems. (idiom)

definition: both sides are willing/by mutual consent
to ask a question, already knowing the answer

pinyin: hao3 ma3 bu4 chi1 hui2 tou2 cao3

definition: ugly people will do all kinds of weird things to get attention (idiom)
(slang) (usu. of a woman) sb who looks stunning from behind/sb who has a great figure but not necessarily an attractive face/abbr. to 背殺|背杀[bei4 sha1]
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3

conjoined twins

definition: to censor an image/to pixelate
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
